name: Hampton Inn San Diego - Kearny Mesa

reviews.text: What a pleasant experience our stay was at this hotel. We were there during a busy holiday weekend -- I believe the entire property was booked -- and yet everything ran as smooth as silk. Our room was as quiet as could be -- we were on the top (5th) floor in the back; that might have helped. Room was spotless and very comfortable. Large, flat-screen TV, fridge in the closet. Good-sized room (King bed, desk and couch). Breakfast that came with the room was better than most -- scrambled eggs and some kind of breakfast meat both days we were there plus a waffle maker and all the regular stuff -- cold and hot cereal, hard-boiled egss, fruit, various breads, yogurt, fruit juices, coffee, etc. Hotel is located in a cluster of hotels right off the 163 freeway, in a mixed-use area. There was what looked like a condo complex next door and miscellaneous businesses down the street. If you're looking for a hotel with restaurants and shops within walking distance, this isn't it. But for travelers with cars, it's great -- only about 15 minutes to downtown San Diego -- including the zoo and Balboa Park -- or a little bit longer to get to Mission Bay. We thought it was a great location. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Couldn't Ask For More

reviews.text: Probably the worst Hampton Inn I have stayed at. The business center is nothing more than a couple of computers with stools, and the printer is behind the reception desk. Drapes don't draw and the street lights come right at your face. No power outlets at working level or even visbile.
reviews.title: Dated Hotel with 20th century amenities

reviews.text: This is our 3rd stay at a Hampton inn. I don't have time to write a long review, and I really don't need to. Room, quiet and clean, staff was just awesome. location was perfect, pool was heated, food was great. gym was clean and air conditioned. The most bang for your buck in San Diego.. you could a bit cheaper, but trust me... don't do it. Hampton Inn's are the way to go!
reviews.title: Best Stay - Hampton will spoil you for all other hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Situated in easy to access location - Secure - Relatively quiet - Attractive interior; clean - Good Breakfast options; this hotel has both healthful and standard fare - Parking lot surrounds the building, which makes it easy to access both rooms and vehicles - Staff is friendly and eager to help, but non-intrusive
reviews.title: Recommended Stay

reviews.text: Traveled with my son's water polo team, and the staff took great care of us! Lots of hungry boys at breakfast, and they never stopped stocking all the breakfast items. Very friendly and courteous staff!
reviews.title: Took Good Care of us!
Great for the price
reviews.text: Really nice place with good amenities at a price that is much lower than expected. Had a very upscale feel...granite bathroom vanity, large flat screen TV. Nice little gym with all of the important pieces of equipment.

The hotel was located just a few minutes from downtown with easy on/off access to Highway 163. Friendly staff and good pool. The breakfast area was good and well kept. I did not use the fitness center.
reviews.title: Good Place to stay

reviews.text: We just stayed at the Hampton Inn, Kearney Mesa this past Friday night and it was your typical Hampton Inn experience. Good customer service, clean and comfortable rooms, and a well maintained property.
reviews.title: What You Expect From Hampton Inn

reviews.text: The only criticism I might have is that the breakfast area is too small to accommodate the number guests at the hotel. Otherwise it was a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel Experience!

reviews.text: The young lady who checked us in was gracious, quick, and accommodating, granting our family's request for two rooms next to each other in record time. The rooms were clean and well maintained, the beds and pillows were so comfortable, and the shower water pressure was great! We had everything that we needed. The breakfast was really good with a lot of variety, and the dining area had good quality tables and chairs. In fact, the whole hotel was decorated with quality, from the furniture to the art work. The staff provided excellent service all around and conveyed verbally and through their attitudes that they really enjoyed working at this hotel. Their care shows! My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and we will definitely stay at this hotel in the future. This Hampton Inn is a winner, through and through!
reviews.title: A good deal

reviews.text: This was an easy place to find, with many great restaurants in the area. It was minutes from Sea World, Old Town, and other places of interest. The room was clean, the staff was great, and the breakfast selections were extensive. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to San Diego!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: This was without a doubt the BEST HAmpton Inn hotel I have stayed at in years. The staff was WONDERFUL We were referred to a delightful restaurant equally terrific (The Godfather) and the staff suggested local attractions to visit which were amazing. We went to the LeJolla COVE the San Diego Zoo and Coronado Island. Amazing trip. THANK YOU
reviews.title: San Diego Kearny Mesa CA

reviews.text: Nice rooms with coffee table and office table, granite top sinks. This must be one of Hampton Inn's newer hotels. The toilet is water-efficient and the towels feel fresh, but there is no microwave. Also, the a/c was rather loud. At first it felt drab, then I realized it is because of the dark green carpet. The breakfast area is small but I never saw it fill to capacity, so I guess they knew before hand the amount of traffic that come and go. The only issue in there is it was a bit dark in some of the table if you want to read the morning papers, supplied everyday. If you are in a hurry in the a.m., they even give brown bag light breakfasts, i.e. muffin and water. As a Hilton affiliate, they give you a welcome cookie at check-in! For its hotel category, it gets 5-stars!
reviews.title: A touch of Hilton
Terrific stay
reviews.text: We arrived and were greated by a very friendly gentlemen. Within just a few minutes we were given keys and in our room. Our suite was huge and spacious which we loved. Also great to be on 1st floor. We had to check out by 4:00am and that too was seamless. We definitely would stay at this Hampton Inn again on furture visits.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for four nights. Its location is ideal. CA highway 163 is within a block and most places of interest are within 10 to 12 minutes. The hotel sits on the corner of Kearny Mesa and Clairemont Mesa roads and there are many restaurants on the latter road. Our room was of a nice size, the bed quite comfortable (although a bit high for some). There was a laptop board which was very useful. Some of the cabinets in the room and the bathroom showed some wear and I am told they may be replaced soon. On the last day a problem developed with the toilet but they moved us quickly across the hall to a similar room.
reviews.title: Among the best

reviews.text: Beautiful soft lighting throughout, with gorgeous dark green granite used in bathrooms and in public areas. Room was spacious. Microwave and fridge. No plug near bed. I had two double beds and bed was WAY TOO SOFT. I didn't try the other one.
reviews.title: Quiet room, great breakfast

reviews.text: Breakfast was wonderful. Would stay there again but will try bed first. Very friendly staff.
reviews.title: ALWAYS Satisfied

reviews.text: GREAT place to stay. Modern, clean, great staff, extremely easy to find. Very comfortable room and just overall nice experience. We were even in a hurry on check out and the housekeeper chased us down in the parking lot TWICE to give us our items we left behind. Oh and great breakfast!
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mum and I stayed 11 nights at this Hampton Inn in mid-April. Front desk service was excellent; our room on the 5th floor was well maintained and clean and the breakfast was more than satisfying. We chose this location for it's convenience to the highways. Only 10 minutes to downtown and La Jolla. The pool area was apparently re-done a few years ago and is a beautiful setting. This was the quietest Hampton I've stayed in...never heard anyone in the halls. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. A special thanks to Robert on the front desk for answering our many questions!.
reviews.title: San Diego Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lynn & Barbara
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

aka: Hampton Inn San Diego - Kearny Mesa Hotel San Diego
